description: In this one-semester module, students will be placed in a company abroad working on selected topics which are important to engineering and technology management. The students will be jointly supervised by a team comprising NUS academic staff, the company’s appointed manager, and an academic staff from the overseas partner university. Assessments will be done periodically (every 2 months), leading to a project report and presentation at the end of the attachment.
preclusion: MT5666 Industrial Attachment (8 MC), MT5900 MOT Research Project (8MC), MT5901 Management Practicum (2MC), MT5902 Management Extended Practicum (4MC)
title: Overseas Industrial Project and Attachment
